data.chText: 一般情况以外的人（或事物）；例外
data.enText: a person or thing that is not included in a general statement

data.chText: 城里大多是现代建筑，不过教堂是个例外。
data.enText: Most of the buildings in the town are modern, but the church is an exception.

data.chText: 私立学校的考试成绩是最好的，很少有例外情况。
data.enText: With very few exceptions, private schools get the best exam results.

data.chText: 那时候谁都没有很多钱，我也不例外。
data.enText: Nobody had much money at the time and I was no exception .

data.chText: 规则的例外；例外的事物
data.enText: a thing that does not follow a rule

data.chText: 可惜优秀的文字作品真是可遇不可求。
data.enText: Good writing is unfortunately the exception rather than the rule (= it is unusual) .

data.chText: 语法规则总是有很多例外。
data.enText: There are always a lot of exceptions to grammar rules.
the exception that proves the rule

data.chText: 反证规律的例外；足以证明普遍性的例外
data.enText: people say that sth is the exception that proves the rule when they are stating sth that seems to be different from the normal situation, but they mean that the normal situation remains true in general

data.chText: 今年多数电子公司都不景气，而我们公司却是普遍中的例外。
data.enText: Most electronics companies have not done well this year, but ours is the exception that proves the rule.
make an exception

data.chText: 允许有例外；让…成为例外
data.enText: to allow sb not to follow the usual rule on one occasion

data.chText: 儿童一般不允许入内，不过这次我可以破例。
data.enText: Children are not usually allowed in, but I'm prepared to make an exception in this case.
take exception to sth

data.chText: （强烈地）反对；生…的气
data.enText: to object strongly to sth; to be angry about sth

data.chText: 你还没告诉我就先对我妻子讲了，为此我非常生气。
data.enText: I take great exception to the fact that you told my wife before you told me.

data.chText: 任何人都不可能对他的意见提出异议。
data.enText: No one could possibly take exception to his comments.
with the exception of

data.chText: 除…之外；不包括…在内
data.enText: except; not including

data.chText: 他的小说除最后一部外全是以意大利为背景。
data.enText: All his novels are set in Italy with the exception of his last.
without exception

data.chText: 一律；无一例外
data.enText: used to emphasize that the statement you are making is always true and everyone or everything is included

data.chText: 所有学生都必须参加英语考试，无一例外。
data.enText: All students without exception must take the English examination.

means: 一般情况以外的人(或事物)

data.enText: the exception that proves the rule

data.chText: 今年多数电子公司都不景气，而我们公司却是普遍中的例外。
data.enText: Most electronics companies have not done well this year, but ours is the exception that proves the rule.

data.enText: to allow sb not to follow the usual rule on one occasion

data.enText: Children are not usually allowed in, but I'm prepared to make an exception in this case.

data.chText: 你还没告诉我就先对我妻子讲了，为此我非常生气。
data.enText: I take great exception to the fact that you told my wife before you told me.

data.enText: No one could possibly take exception to his comments.
with the exception of

data.enText: All his novels are set in Italy with the exception of his last.
without exception

data.chText: 一律；无一例外
data.enText: used to emphasize that the statement you are making is always true and everyone or everything is included

data.chText: 所有学生都必须参加英语考试，无一例外。
data.enText: All students without exception must take the English examination.

example: with the exception of the children, everyone was told the news

tr: an instance that does not conform to a rule or generalization
the only exception was her last child"

value.def: An exception is a particular thing, person, or situation that is not included in a general statement, judgment, or rule.

example.ex: Few guitarists can sing as well as they can play; Eddie, however, is an exception...
example.tran: 很少有吉他手唱歌像弹吉他那么好，然而埃迪是个例外。

example.ex: There were no floral offerings at the ceremony, with the exception of a single red rose...
example.tran: 除了一朵红色玫瑰花外，仪式上没有任何献花。

example.ex: With few exceptions, guests are booked for week-long visits.
example.tran: 宾客们几乎毫无例外地预订了一周游。

value.def: If you make a general statement, and then say that something or someone is no exception, you are emphasizing that they are included in that statement.

example.ex: Marketing is applied to everything these days, and books are no exception...
example.tran: 现在市场营销已无处不在，图书也不例外。

example.ex: Most people have no real idea how to change to healthy food, and Maureen was no exception.
example.tran: 大多数人并不真正清楚究竟如何转而食用健康食品，莫琳也是如此。

value.def: If you are making a general statement and you say that something is the exception that proves the rule, you mean that although it seems to contradict your statement, in most other cases your statement will be true.

example.ex: Wine-making and accountants don't usually go together, but Thierry Hasard is an exception that proves the rule.
example.tran: 酿酒和会计通常不搭边，而蒂埃里·阿萨尔却是普遍中的例外。

gramarinfo.label: <l>exception</l> and V inflect, usu v-link PHR

value.tran: 证明普遍性的例外；规则必有例外

value.def: If you take exception to something, you feel offended or annoyed by it, usually with the result that you complain about it.

example.ex: He also took exception to having been spied on...
And the problem is that they take exception to any kind of noise whatsoever.
example.tran: 问题是他们反感任何形式的噪音。

value.def: You use with the exception of to introduce a thing or person that is not included in a general statement that you are making.

example.ex: Yesterday was a day off for everybody, with the exception of Lawrence...
example.tran: 昨天所有人都放一天假，劳伦斯除外。

example.ex: In virtually every sport, with the possible exception of women's gymnastics, the players are now bigger and stronger than before.
example.tran: 几乎在所有体育运动中，可能除女子体操外，现在的运动员都要比过去更加高大强壮。

value.def: You use without exception to emphasize that the statement you are making is true in all cases.

example.ex: The vehicles are without exception old, rusty and dented...
example.tran: 那些车辆一律都很破旧，锈迹斑斑，布满凹痕。

example.ex: Almost without exception those convicted were our friends and colleagues.
example.tran: 那些被判有罪的人几乎无一例外都是我们的朋友和同事。

gramarinfo.label: PHR with cl/group, PHR after v
